channel.title: Problems with JDK , please help
channel.description:
Sorry if there are already topic's about this, but can't find any.
well, this is my problem. i can connect on 127.0.1(localhost right?) but my friends cant connect on my server ip. I had it working on JDK 6u7 but reinstalled my pc so i need to download an new java. the problem is there is only 6u10 (the second on the list from java download section) and i is only an OFFLINE JDK (picture, hard to read but try:P). when i dont have online version of JDK my friends can't join right? anybody knows where to get an ONLINE version of JDK or has an older version of JDK please post it. i'll be very happy with any comments
Thanks already for LOOKING this (btw im a nub coder so please no comments like "noob" etc)sorry for bad english.......
weird the picture dont work http://img367.imageshack.us/img367/2425/imagesjr1.jpg [img]http://img367.imageshack.us/img367/2425/imagesjr1.jpg[/img]

item.title: Problems with JDK , please help
item.dc:creator: @m3rcle m3rcle
item.description:
@m3rcle wrote:

tajkillerscape:

make sure your ip (default gateway) is the same that you port forwarded on your router…

do you mean at no-ip.com? or when portforwarding? the server already runned before I reinstalled my PC so the Portforward is already done and did work. it’s just people can’t connect to my server, only i can on 127.0.1[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 29, 2008, 02:00:03 pm[/size][hr][quote=“tajkillerscape, post:4, topic:239920”]make sure your ip (default gateway) is the same that you port forwarded on your router…[/quote]

i tried, but when i reinstall i won’t get an new getaway right???[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 30, 2008, 09:16:01 am[/size][hr]anyone can help?

Read full topic

item.title: Problems with JDK , please help

item.description:
@tajkillerscape wrote:

make sure your ip (default gateway) is the same that you port forwarded on your router…

@m3rcle wrote:

i don’t understand reallly, but i DID portforward already because the server already RUNNED on JDK update 7, its just the java i think
